issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has not yet been validated, and is not currently being investigated.
status.name: Unconfirmed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

Attempted to use {{euca-bundle-vol}} on Ubuntu Xenial paravirt instance, and the following error was returned:
{code}
ubuntu@euca-172-31-14-173:~$ sudo euca-bundle-vol -d /mnt//ubuntu-paravirt/ -r x86_64 -k /tmp/certs/qa-admin-pk.pem -c /tmp/certs/qa-admin-cert.pem --ec2cert /tmp/certs/g-22-07.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.crt -u 001879049886 --kernel eki-e4d28515 --ramdisk eri-845814fa -e /tmp/certs/,/mnt/ubuntu-paravirt
euca-bundle-vol: error: local variable 'root_device' referenced before assignment
{code}

*Signs*

euca2ools was downloaded from Github and installed using setuptools. 
{code}
ubuntu@euca-172-31-14-173:~/euca2ools$ sudo python setup.py install
running install
running bdist_egg
running egg_info
writing requirements to euca2ools.egg-info/requires.txt
writing euca2ools.egg-info/PKG-INFO
writing top-level names to euca2ools.egg-info/top_level.txt
writing dependency_links to euca2ools.egg-info/dependency_links.txt
reading manifest file 'euca2ools.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'
reading manifest template 'MANIFEST.in'
writing manifest file 'euca2ools.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'
installing library code to build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg
running install_lib
running build_py
exceptions euca2ools/exceptions.py euca2ools
util euca2ools/util.py euca2ools
.......
........

fields.summary: BundleVol returns error 'root_device' reference before assignment

comments.body:
Debug output:
{code}

{code}

This happens when euca-bundle-vol walks through the entirety of /proc/mounts and doesn't find anything mounted on /.  I can add a check for this, but to get to the bottom of this problem a copy of /proc/mounts on the affected machine would be quite useful.

[~gholms], the image contents can be found here - http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/xenial/current/xenial-server-cloudimg-amd64.tar.gz.  After I decompressed the file, I registered the kernel, ramdisk and image accordingly.  Hope this helps.  Let me know if you need any additional information.
Issue no longer being investigated due to product EOL.
